name: Anthony FRANKLIN, Appellant v. PENNSYLVANIA DEPARTMENT OF CORRECTION, and Commonwealth of Pennsylvania at Delaware and Philadelphia Counties et al., Appellees
name_abbreviation: Franklin v. Pennsylvania Department of Correction

parties: Anthony FRANKLIN, Appellant v. PENNSYLVANIA DEPARTMENT OF CORRECTION, and Commonwealth of Pennsylvania at Delaware and Philadelphia Counties et al., Appellees

opinions.text:
ORDER
PER CURIAM
AND NOW, this 22nd day of November, 2016, the Order of the Commonwealth Court is hereby AFFIRMED, without prejudice to any right Appellant may have, pursuant to Fajohn v. Com., Dep’t of Corrs., 547 Pa. 649, 692 A.2d 1067 (1997), to seek modification of his sentence nunc pro tunc in the court of common pleas.
opinions.author: PER CURIAM

casebody.head_matter:
161 A.3d 794
Anthony FRANKLIN, Appellant v. PENNSYLVANIA DEPARTMENT OF CORRECTION, and Commonwealth of Pennsylvania at Delaware and Philadelphia Counties et al., Appellees
No. 20 EAP 2016
Supreme Court of Pennsylvania.
November 22, 2016
